reviews.review: "Perfectly balanced, as all things should be" is a line spoken by Thanos in this film and also a perfect description of Marvel's newest triumph. Ten years of movies have been building up to this moment. After ten years of offering some really solid entertainment, Marvel Studios produces a film that, while colorful and filled with some of the most fun moments in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, is also one of the darkest, most heartbreaking and most haunting Hollywood blockbusters ever made. Balancing different tones was never hard for the Russo Brothers, but with "Avengers: Infinity War" they also proved that it's not hard for them to bring together an insane amount of heroes for one big team up and somehow give them all their moments to shine. The character interactions are in fact, part of both some of the funniest and some of the saddest scenes in this cinematic epic. The least you know about this film the better, since it's one big, shocking surprise overall. This is very much Thanos' film, as he easily has the most screen time and we go on a journey with him in his attempt to get these powerful gems, called the infinity stones, to accomplish his goals. Probably the most terrifying and the best written villain ever in a comic book movie and maybe even in film history as a whole, Josh Brolin gives a motion capture performance that's worth all the praise that it has got and even more. The visual effects are breathtaking, the soundtrack perfectly captures the dark tone of the film, the action is more impressive than it has ever been, the tension is here, the stakes, the consequences. Everything a person can ask from this movie, it delivers. It feels like Marvel, Star Wars, Lord of the Rings and Game of Thrones all had a baby. The ending is as haunting as that of a horror movie. By far the most intense cinematic experience I've ever had in my entire life. "Infinity War" is the best superhero, the best supervillain and overall, one of the best films in history.
Infinity out of 10. I'm a huge marvel fan and I've already seen this twice and most likely gonna see it a third time in theatres.

Seems I'm more into Marvel's individual superhero movies.. Like Thor, Iron Man, Captain America, Guardians of the galaxy, Dr. Strange, Black Panther.... Etc, all these were amazing. Yet, I'm not that big of a fan of Avengers all together. But this one was really good but still the plot was weak and could have been better to reach 5/5.. So I give it a 4/5
Another fantastic Avengers movie. Get ready for a sad ending, but remember there is a sequel. Hopefully everything will work out. For all of us.
Fantastic. They're getting really good at this sort of movies.

Looking at the endings of the Marvel movies that lead to this one, it is pretty Sad, how they ignored most of the feelings that came with them. The Ending of THe movie Seems Pointless and Without meaning, knowing what is planned. Flat and Meaningless Battlescenes Steal the time that was needed to integrate the emotional Outcomes of the direct precursors

It felt like they tried too hard to fit everyone in this movie and as a result characters were left with little to no part and so the ending felt less than dramatic. I honestly don’t know why people were so shaken by the ending... like OBVIOUSLY that’s not how it all ends, there’s no way that Marvel/Disney would kill off that many characters in one go permanently. Way too much money left to be milked from this cash cow franchise. That being said, Thor definitely stole the show and saved this movie for me. Chris Hemsworth was fantastic. I never really cared for Thor until this movie, now he’s for sure a favorite.
Action action and ^ore action , badass movie
